div.h3: 2020 NJ State Seal of Biliteracy Recipients

div.p:
Good afternoon,
Today we will recognize our students who received the 2020 New Jersey State Seal of Biliteracy. These students needed to demonstrate a proficiency level of Intermediate Mid in all four domains of a world language. In addition, they were required to demonstrate proficiency in English by meeting the State high school graduation requirements for English language arts or through attaining the appropriate cut score on the ACCESS for English Language Learners (ELLs) assessment. The attached table contains a list of their names and the world language for which they each earned the Seal. Once again, please join me in congratulating them, their parents, and their teachers for an outstanding job.
Many thanks and enjoy your evening.
Ed Grande

li.a: 2020 NJ State Seal of Biliteracy Recipients(1).pdf

div.p:
Good afternoon,
We were planning to have a Showcase of Success at our April Board of Education meeting as a means of honoring some of our more than well-deserving students and staff members. Since doing so was not possible, we will be recognizing those individuals via our daily Honeywell messages instead.
We will begin today with those students who earned perfect scores on one of last spring's (2019) New Jersey Student Learning Assessment (NJSLA) tests. Given how challenging these tests are, this was no small feat. A list containing their names and the tests for which they each received a perfect score is attached. Please join me in congratulating them, their parents, and their teachers for an outstanding job.
As always, thank you and have a good one.
Ed Grande

Good afternoon,
Some virtual reading sessions have been posted on our district website under the "More" tab and then the "Year-Round/Remote Learning" sub-tab towards the top right of the page for our preschool and elementary students to enjoy. A special thanks goes to our ALJ Key Club members who prepared these recordings.
As a reminder, please check the School Counseling Department's Instagram page each week for some fun, engaging activities.
Thanks and be safe!
Ed Grande

Good afternoon,
Hope you and your families enjoyed our spring break and found the past week to be a relaxing one. As a reminder, Governor Murphy has closed all New Jersey schools through at least Friday, May 15. As we get closer to that time, he will be making a reevaluation regarding any possible reopening. Regardless of whether or not schools are able to reopen after the 15th, all school-related activities and field trips scheduled for the month of May are being canceled.
ALJ senior Taylor Turek has led the creation of an Instagram posting that highlights the college admissions of the ALJ Class of 2020. This posting can be found on the Instagram account @aljhsseniors2020 and also on the ALJ Facebook page. As you will see, we, as a school community, have a great deal to be proud of!
Thanks for all that you do, and enjoy the rest of the day and evening ahead.

Good evening,
Thanks for another great week of remote learning. I would be remiss if I did not thank our students and teachers. Their immense effort and success are clearly evident. I would also like to thank our parents, staff members, and administrators for their remarkable support of our virtual classrooms. Spring break will begin tomorrow (Friday, April 10) and run through Friday, April 17. We hope that this break provides much needed restorative time for you and your families. The Governor will not be making a determination as to when schools will reopen or remain closed until April 17th, so our remote learning will be resuming on Monday, April 20 until further notice.
With the exception of tomorrow (Friday the 10th), lunches will still be available for pickup during the break.
We have asked our teachers not to assign work over the break so that our students can have some relaxing "away" time. If you email a teacher, school counselor, or child study team member during the break, please be patient with expecting a response as they too will hopefully be enjoying this time with their families and therefore may not respond until our return to remote learning on the 20th. Kindly extend this same patience to our administrators and support staff since many of them will be using vacation and/or personal days during the break.
Mrs. Lori Kowalski, our school nursing supervisor, will be maintaining a virtual school nurse's office for all of our schools during the break. Should a student, family member, or staff member have a question or concern related to COVID-19 or even one of a more general nature, he/she can initiate contact with Mrs. Kowalski by emailing her at lkowalski@clarkschools.org.
Below you will find a reminder of some good health practices for us all to maintain during this break.
Enjoy the "away" time and your holiday. Most importantly, stay safe and Crusader Strong! We will be sure to reconnect on the 20th.
Ed Grande

div.div: Wednesday, April 8, 2020
Good afternoon,

Thank you for your support in keeping our Crusader community together and positive during this challenging time. Below is a link to a We Are Crusader Strong video. Many thanks goes to those of you who are featured in the video. A very special thanks goes to ALJ Mathematics Teacher and Head Football/Assistant Track Coach Anthony DelConte for leading this endeavor. As Mr. DelConte said, we are sure to overcome this challenge as we are Crusader Strong!
Hope you enjoy.
Superintendent of Schools

div.p:
Good afternoon,
Our School Counseling Department, led by Mr. Andrew Amendola, has been engaging our students in fun activities while they are at home. This week, for example, our high school counselors are collecting pictures of our seniors wearing their college acceptance gear. Our middle school students and staff members are recreating the YMCA song in "CHK Style" while our elementary students are playing Pictionary games between both schools. Please be on the lookout for these types of activities aimed at bringing some recreational-type fun to each week's remote learning.
Many thanks and enjoy the evening ahead.
Ed Grande

div.h3: Michael Baker Jersey Day and Scholarship Fund

div.p:
Good afternoon,
Hope the weekend was a relaxing one for everyone. We are asking all students, parents, and staff members to consider wearing their favorite team jerseys tomorrow (Tuesday, April 7) as a means of honoring the memory of Michael Baker. Michael is an ALJ graduate who passed last year. He was an avid baseball fan who loved the Yankees. If you choose to participate, please post a picture to the FKH and/or district Facebook page(s). Kindly know that a Michael Baker Scholarship Fund exists, and scholarships will be awarded to three graduating seniors of the ALJ Class of 2020. Should you want to make a donation, a check made payable to "The Michael Baker Scholarship Fund" can be mailed to 33 Deerwood Drive, Clark, NJ 07066.
Thank you for your consideration of tomorrow's jersey day, and enjoy the rest of today.
Ed Grande
Many thanks for a great third week. I hope that the upcoming weekend will allow everyone to recharge. Below is a link to an uplifting video that will hopefully put a smile on your face.
Until we reconnect on Monday, stay Clark Schools Strong!

Good afternoon,
Below is a link to a number of flyers published by the New Jersey Department of Children and Families (NJ DCF) that are related to COVID-19. The hope is that they will be helpful to you or someone whom you know.
https://www.nj.gov/dcf/news/publications/covid19.html

As a reminder, lunches for those students in our free/reduced lunch program are available for pickup each school day at the Main Entrance of ALJ from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Two lunch choices are available to select from on any given day and, on select days, Maschio's, our food services company, will be sending special treats to be distributed with the lunches. Their kind hope is to give our children a nice surprise. Again, please help spread the word so that we can get the needed food to our students. If a parent/guardian is unable to make the pickup, a designated other can do so. If such an arrangement needs to be made, please email me at egrande@clarkschools.org.
Thanks and enjoy the rest of your day.
Ed Grande

Good afternoon,
I just wanted to provide everyone with some information regarding the implications of this spring's cancellation of statewide assessments. Please know that this cancellation will not prevent students from meeting their graduation assessment requirement. The New Jersey Department of Education (NJDOE) is continuing to process portfolio appeals for the small percentage of current seniors throughout the state who have not yet met their graduation assessment requirement. Our students who are in need of these portfolios have already submitted the required work.
Current juniors and sophomores will also have access to both the menu of alternate assessments (e.g., the SAT or ACT) and the portfolio appeal process as pathways to complete their graduation assessment requirement. These students are not required to take the New Jersey Student Learning Assessment (NJSLA) in order to access the menu of alternate assessments or the portfolio appeal process.
A link to detailed information regarding the graduation assessment requirement is given below.
https://www.state.nj.us/education/assessment/parents/GradReq.pdf
For parents of current fourth and seventh-grade students, we, as a school district, will be looking into the use of an alternate assessment in place of the NJSLA as a factor towards determining placement into middle and high school courses for the 2021-2022 school year (i.e., two years away as we already have the data that we need for next year's placement decisions).
I hope that this information is helpful, and we will be sure to share any additional information as it becomes available. Enjoy your evening.
Ed Grande

p.span:
Good afternoon,
Please go to www.clarkschools.org under "Pride Newsletter" towards the mid-bottom of the page to find a digital copy of the March 2020 Pride district newsletter. Much appreciation goes to those students and staff members who are either featured or made a submission. A very special thanks goes to ALJ English Teacher and Pride Advisor Katrina Poskay for all of her good, hard work in compiling this newsletter.
Many thanks and have a relaxing evening ahead.
Ed Grande

div.p:
Good afternoon,
I hope that the weekend was a restful one and that your new week is off to a productive start. Parents/guardians in need of child care can contact their County Child Care Resource and Referral Agency (CCR&R). CCR&Rs will have the most up-to-date information on available child care options and subsidies. Please see the attached flyer that includes a link to by-county CCR&R contact information.
Thanks and enjoy the rest of your day.

div.h3: End of Week Two and Closure Extended Through Fri., April 17

div.p:
Good afternoon,
As of yesterday, the closure for schools throughout the State was extended to at least Friday, April 17. Our spring break will still run from Friday, April 10 through Friday, April 17. As a result, the remote learning will be suspended during that time.
Thanks to our entire school community for another great week. I know that a lot of information is being shared, and, as a result, some of you may very understandably be feeling inundated. All of our districtwide Honeywell messages related to the closure are posted at www.clarkschools.org under "News and Announcements" should you or someone whom you know want to refer back to them. In addition, a summary sheet of the key email addresses that have been shared is also posted there. Please know that you can reach out to any of our administrators or me should you have a question. Enjoy the upcoming weekend, and, most importantly, stay safe and Clark Schools Strong!
Ed Grande

div.h3: Technology Helpdesk and Frequently Asked Questions

div.div: Thursday, March 26, 2020
Good afternoon,

The below link will take you to our remote learning technology page. Within that page you will find a sub-link to our virtual helpdesk along with the answers to some frequently asked questions regarding the technology needed for remote learning. This page will be updated as we move forward and learn more. When submitting a request through the helpdesk, please include the required information that is listed on the page as this information will allow our technology team to most quickly meet your needs. Due to the possible volume of requests, kindly trust that your request will be addressed as soon as possible. All technology-related requests should go through the helpdesk for the reason of consistency across the district. Such an approach will allow us to most efficiently meet everyone's needs.
As always, thank you for your cooperation. Have a good evening.
Ed Grande
Superintendent of Schools

div.p:
Good afternoon,
As we move ahead, if your child is ill and unable to participate remotely on any given school day, please proceed similarly to how you would on a more typical day. In other words, either enter the absence into Genesis or send an email to the appropriate address listed below. The email will take the place of a phone call to the school since the building is closed and no one is there to receive the call.
ALJ: ALJRemoteAttendance@clarkschools.org
CHK: CHKRemoteAttendance@clarkschools.org
FKH: FKHRemoteAttendance@clarkschools.org
VRS: VRSRemoteAttendance@clarkschools.org
CPA: CPARemoteAttendance@clarkschools.org
In addition, kindly err on the side of caution and email your child's teacher if your child is ill and unable to meet a given deadline or participate in a remote meeting.
On another note, the State of New Jersey is canceling this spring's state standardized testing, i.e., the New Jersey Student Learning Assessments (NJSLA), ACCESS for ELLs, and the Dynamic Learning Maps (DLM) assessment. In addition, the College Board is making modifications to this spring's Advanced Placement (AP) testing program, and related information will be forthcoming from the School Counseling Department to the involved students and their parents.
As always, thank you and have a good one.
Ed Grande

div.h3: April Activities and RWJB Hospital Rahway Donations

div.p:
Good afternoon,
Regardless of whether or not schools are able to reopen after April 3, all school-related activities scheduled for the month of April (including Band Bonanza on April 7, meetings, field trips, award ceremonies, etc.) are either being canceled or postponed.
Please see attached for a document that gives details regarding donations to Robert Wood Johnson Barnabas (RWJB) Hospital Rahway. Many thanks in advance for giving their most worthwhile of requests your consideration as these donations will assist in treating patients during the coronavirus outbreak.
Enjoy the evening ahead.

div.h3: Remote Meetings and Public Library Cards

div.p:
Good afternoon,
Hope the weekend was an enjoyable one and that the new week is off to a productive start. As we are continuing with our remote learning approach, an increasing number of our teachers are opting to conduct virtual meetings with their students. Kindly remind your children that each school's code of conduct will still be in place during these virtual meetings, and therefore, they should not be recording the session, each other, or the teacher. We have been fortunate not to have any such issues arise yet but wanted to give this proactive reminder.
On another note, please see attached from the Public Library regarding the obtaining of a library card if your family does not already have one so that online materials can be accessed.
As always, many thanks for your cooperation. Enjoy the rest of the day.

p.span:
Good afternoon,
I would like to take this opportunity to thank everyone in our school community for a great first week of remote learning. Our students, with assistance from their parents, have been hard at work alongside our teachers, staff, and administrators. In addition, the support from our Board of Education, Mayor Bonaccorso and the Township Offices, and the larger community has been remarkable. While all of this good work was taking place from our homes, the Pritchard staff continued to diligently clean and disinfect our buildings. They too are deserving of a very special thanks.
Please enjoy the well-deserved weekend ahead, and stay healthy and safe. I am looking forward to being energized again next week by all of you.
Ed Grande

div.h3: Coronavirus Plan Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) Document

div.p:
As a reminder, grab-and-go lunches for those students in the free and reduced lunch program are available for pickup each school day at the Main Entrance of Arthur L. Johnson High School from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Kindly help spread the word so that we can get the needed food to our students. If a parent/guardian is unable to make the pickup, a designated other can do so. If such an arrangement needs to be made, please email me at egrande@clarkschools.org.
Many thanks for working together during this time. Your collective efforts are most appreciated.

There will be a final opportunity for devices to be picked up this Thursday (March 19) in the ALJ Instructional Media Center (IMC) from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. We are adding these final technology "office hours" since our remote learning will have been in place for three days and therefore families may have a better idea of their device needs. Again, this will be our final set of technology "office hours."

div.div: As a reminder, please stop by our technology "office hours" in the ALJ Instructional Media Center (IMC) this evening (Monday) from 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. or tomorrow (Tuesday) morning from 9 a.m. to 11 a.m. should your child need a device.

Comcast (https://www.internetessentials.com/covid19) is offering free internet service for 60 days. You would need to apply at https://www.internetessentials.com, and they will send a free box to your home.

On another note, a change is being made to our lunch plan due to our need to account for the lunches via a roster. These lunches will be available each school day for pickup starting tomorrow (Tuesday) at the ALJ Main Entrance from 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

div.p:
As was already communicated by our principals, our buildings will be open during certain time frames tomorrow (Monday, March 16) should a student or staff member have items that they will need to have at home with them during the closure but that are still in the building.
Those time frames by building are as follows:
ALJ: 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.
CHK: 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.
FKH: 7:15 a.m. to 10:15 a.m.
VRS: 7:15 a.m. to 10:15 a.m.
CPA: 7:15 a.m. to 10:15 a.m.
Please know that, after these time frames, building access will not be granted until further notice with the exception of the technology "office hours" on Monday evening and Tuesday morning in the ALJ Instructional Media Center (IMC).
Thank you for your cooperation

div.h3: School Closing--Monday, March 16 to Friday, April 3

div.div: Please see the below link to an article regarding a very dangerous trend known as the "Skull Breaker Challenge" that is occurring through the social media app TikTok. While we have yet to hear of our students participating in such behavior, we wanted to give you a heads-up so that you could talk to them about the associated dangers.
As always, if you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to reach out to your child's school counselor.
Many thanks and enjoy the weekend ahead.
Ed Grande

div.h3: Congratulations to Our 2019-20 Governor's Educators of the Year
Arthur L Johnson Winter Concert - 12/17/19 at 7:00 PM
Union County Teacher of the Year
Congratulations ALJ as Being Named a State School of Character!!!

div.p: Tuesday, June 2, 2020 (if only one snow giveback day); then
Friday, June 12, 2020 (if only two snow giveback days); and then
Friday, May 22, 2020 (if three snow giveback days)
Please note: All incoming grade K students will follow the after redistricting map.
All new students in grades one to five will be assigned to FKH or VRS based on the enrollment counts at the time of registration.

div.h3: Strengthening Career and Technical Education for the 21st Century Act (Perkins V) Family/Parent and Student Surveys

li.a: Memo regarding Family Parent and Student Surveys(1).docx

div.div: There was a programming issue on Genesis's end of the software with the large number of preset passwords. They did not anticipate this problem prior to our actual implementation. Please check your email account that you have on file with the school as a new temporary password will be sent there.
If you have any further issues moving ahead, kindly reach out to our Genesis help desk (genesis@clarkschools.org). Many thanks for your understanding and patience.

div.p: Our district has recently upgraded its student data management system by implementing the Genesis software interface. This program is a versatile one that should greatly enhance communication between our school district and families by, for example, being inclusive of an updated Parent Portal. In order to begin the process of registering with the program, please go to https://parents.genesisedu.com/clark. In order to log into the system, use the email address where your child(ren)’s report cards have previously been sent as your username. If you are new to our district, use the email address(es) that you provided on the registration paperwork. Your temporary password for the system should have been sent to that address. Kindly know that you will be able to change your password and other information, including your email address(es), after you initially log in. A Genesis user guide will also be sent to the email account attached to your login information as well. This year we will again be using email as the primary mode of sending written communication home throughout our district. As a result, please make certain that your email address(es) is/are kept current and updated within the Genesis system.

Kindly note that it is recommended that parents/guardians do not share their login information with their children. Students in grades five to twelve will have accounts of their own to access their records, schedules, and other information. They too can access their Genesis accounts by visiting the same link that was provided above but by entering the six-digit student identification numbers connected to their school email accounts as their usernames. They should enter the temporary passwords sent to these school email accounts.

This new system is ready for you to access beginning today (Thursday, August 16). Please pay careful attention to any messages that are posted when you log in each time as important information will be displayed. If you or your children have any questions or trouble logging in, reach out to our district Genesis help desk at genesis@clarkschools.org. In addition, visit our district website at www.clarkschools.org and, under the “More” tab towards the top right of that page, you will find a “Genesis Student Information System” sub-tab. This sub-tab currently houses a copy of the Parent User Guide, and additional resources will be added there as they become needed.

div.h3: Clark Schools Ranked #67 in State by Background Checks.org

div.p: These resources can be found under the "More" tab on the top of this page. Additional resources will be added as they become available.
Grade 5 students will be assessed from 4/20 - 4/29 excluding April 23 which is Take Your Child to Work Day.

Board of Education Meeting - This meeting will open at 5:30 p.m. in the Media Center of the Arthur L. Johnson High School located at 365 Westfield Avenue, and immediately go into Executive Session. Public Session will begin at 7:00 p.m. and will be held in the Clark Council Chambers located at 315 Westfield Avenue
